Student Setup Guide

Author

HPM 883

Published

January 13, 2026

HPM 883 Computing Setup Guide

This guide walks you through setting up your computing environment for HPM 883. Complete these steps before the first class or during the first week.

ImportantRequired Software

You need to install:

  1. R (version 4.3 or higher)
  2. Positron (recommended) or RStudio
  3. Git and a GitHub account
  4. Posit Cloud account ($5/month)
  5. Quarto (usually bundled with Positron/RStudio)

Step 1: Install R

Windows

Open PowerShell and run:

winget install --id R-project.R

Or download from CRAN.

macOS

Open Terminal and run:

brew install --cask r

Or download from CRAN.

Verify Installation

Open a terminal and type:

R --version

You should see R version 4.3.0 or higher.

Step 2: Install Positron (Recommended IDE)

Positron is Posit’s new IDE with built-in AI assistance. It’s free and actively developed.

Download

  1. Go to positron.posit.co
  2. Download the installer for your operating system
  3. Run the installer

Why Positron?

Feature Positron RStudio
Built-in AI assistant ✓ Yes No
VS Code extensions ✓ 1000s Limited
Active development ✓ Very active Maintenance only
Python support First-class Secondary
Price Free Free

Alternative: RStudio

If you prefer RStudio, download from posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop.

Step 3: Install Git and Create GitHub Account

Install Git

Windows:

winget install Git.Git

macOS:

brew install git

Configure Git

Open a terminal and run (use your actual name and email):

git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your.email@unc.edu"

Create GitHub Account

  1. Go to github.com
  2. Sign up with your UNC email (you get free Pro features as a student)
  3. Verify your email address

Connect Git to GitHub

Generate an SSH key (recommended):

ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your.email@unc.edu"

Press Enter to accept defaults. Then add to GitHub:

  1. Copy your public key: cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub
  2. Go to GitHub → Settings → SSH and GPG keys → New SSH key
  3. Paste and save

Verify Connection

ssh -T git@github.com

You should see: “Hi username! You’ve successfully authenticated…”

Step 4: Set Up Posit Cloud

Posit Cloud provides a browser-based R environment for in-class exercises.

Create Account

  1. Go to posit.cloud
  2. Sign up with your UNC email
  3. Subscribe to the Student plan ($5/month)
NoteCourse Requirement

The $5/month Posit Cloud subscription is a required course cost. This gives you:

  • 75 project hours/month (plenty for class)
  • 4 GB RAM per project
  • Up to 20 projects

Join Course Workspace

After enrollment, you’ll receive a link to join the HPM 883 course workspace. This gives you access to pre-configured projects for in-class exercises.

Step 5: Install Quarto

Quarto is the publishing system we use for labs and the capstone project.

Check if Already Installed

Positron and recent RStudio versions include Quarto. Check:

quarto --version

If not found, download from quarto.org/docs/get-started.

Step 6: Accept GitHub Classroom Assignment

Once the semester starts, you’ll receive GitHub Classroom assignment links.

How It Works

  1. Click the assignment link (e.g., https://classroom.github.com/a/xyz123)
  2. Authorize GitHub Classroom (first time only)
  3. Accept the assignment → This creates your personal repository
  4. Clone to your computer:
git clone git@github.com:unc-hpm-quant/lab-0-yourusername.git
  1. Open the .Rproj file in Positron/RStudio

First Time Setup (renv)

When you first open a project, restore packages:

renv::restore()

This installs all required packages in the correct versions.

Workflow Summary

In-Class Exercises (Posit Cloud)

  1. Log into Posit Cloud
  2. Open the class project
  3. Follow along with the instructor
  4. No submission needed (formative)

Labs & Assignments (Local + GitHub)

  1. Accept GitHub Classroom assignment
  2. Clone to local machine
  3. Open in Positron/RStudio
  4. Run renv::restore() (first time)
  5. Complete the assignment
  6. Render to HTML
  7. Commit and push to GitHub
  8. Verify submission on GitHub

Capstone Project

Same as labs, but uses the extended capstone template with:

  • targets pipeline
  • Pre-analysis plan
  • Multi-file structure

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

Problem Solution
renv::restore() fails Delete renv/library/, restart R, try again
Package not found Run renv::install("package_name")
Git push rejected Run git pull first, then push
Quarto render fails Check YAML header syntax
GitHub auth fails Regenerate SSH key, re-add to GitHub
Posit Cloud slow Increase project RAM in settings

Getting Help

  1. Slack #hpm883-help — Post questions, classmates can help
  2. Office Hours — See course schedule
  3. GitHub Issues — For persistent technical problems

Verification Checklist

Before the first class, verify:

Complete Lab 0 during Week 1 to verify everything works together.
